sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"毛毯，地毯"之意。
means: carpet ： 指用来铺地板或楼梯的厚实的棉、毛地毯。
blanket ： 指厚实的棉、毛织品，用于铺床或披在身上保暖的毛毯。
rug ： 指小地毯或旅行用的小毛毯。

word_mean: 在闸、坝上游的透水地基表面填筑的用以延长渗径的近水平向的防渗设施。

sentence.Network_en: Wrap your baby snugly in a shawl or blanket.
sentence.Network_cn: 拿一条披巾或毯子把宝宝舒舒服服地裹起来。

phrase.cizu_name: born on the wrong side of the blanket

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (denoting undyed woollen cloth): via Old Northern French from Old French blanc 'white', ultimately of Germanic origin

encyclopedia.content: Blanket的简介 Blanket是流行天王Michael Jackson的第二个儿子。 个人简介： 英文姓名：Prince Michael Jackson,Ⅱ 小名：毯毯、Blanket、毯子、毯宝 性别：男 出生日期：2002年2月21日 父亲：Michael Joseph Jackson 母亲：未知（Blanket是试管婴儿） 哥哥：Prince Michael Jackson 姐姐：Paris-Michael Katherine Jackson 祖父：Joseph Walter Jackson 祖母：Katherine Esther Jackson（现为Blanket和哥哥姐姐的监护人） 星座：

entry.def: A blanket is a large square or rectangular piece of thick cloth, especially one which you put on a bed to keep you warm.
A blanket of something such as snow is a continuous layer of it which hides what is below or beyond it.

example.ex: The mud disappeared under a blanket of snow...
Cold damp air brought in the new year under a blanket of fog.
example.tran: 厚厚的一层雾伴着阴冷潮湿的空气迎来了新的一年。

entry.tran: （不好的情感、性质等的）弥漫，充斥
entry.def: You can refer to something such as an unpleasant emotion or an undesirable quality that seems to affect every aspect of a particular situation as a blanket of that emotion or quality.

example.ex: It seems as if the blanket of depression is in some way necessary to help them blot out the even greater pain of real life...
example.tran: 似乎这种弥漫的抑郁情绪多少能帮助他们忘却一些现实生活中更大的痛苦。

entry.def: If something such as snow blankets an area, it covers it.

example.ex: More than a foot of snow blanketed parts of Michigan...
example.tran: 密歇根州的部分地区被超过一英尺厚的积雪所覆盖。

example.ex: With a thick mist now blanketing the trees, I got thoroughly lost.
example.tran: 此时浓雾笼罩着林木，我彻底迷路了。

entry.tran: 通用的；全面的；无一例外的
entry.def: You use blanket to describe something when you want to emphasize that it affects or refers to every person or thing in a group, without any exceptions.

example.ex: There's already a blanket ban on foreign unskilled labour in Japan.
example.tran: 日本已经全面禁止国外非熟练工入境。

example.ex: ...the blanket coverage of the Barcelona Olympics.
example.tran: 对巴塞罗那奥运会的全面报道

means.word_mean: 1. bedding that keeps a person warm in bed;

sentences.sentence: "he pulled the covers over his head and went to sleep"

means.word_mean: 3. a layer of lead surrounding the highly reactive core of a nuclear reactor
1. cover as if with a blanket;

list.explanation: (流浪者用语)"加州毯"(指露宿时盖在身上的报纸)

example.en: He spent his nights on park benches under California blankets.

example.en: Blanket drill is the only thing I like in the army.
example.zh: 睡觉是我在军队里惟一舆欢干的事。

jushi.english: A blanket insurance policy insures a car against all kinds of accidents.
